newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MALAYSIA END-SEPT PALM OIL STOCK SEEN AT 1 MLN TNS.
newsitem.headline: MALAYSIA END-SEPT PALM OIL STOCK SEEN AT 1 MLN TNS.

text.p: Malaysia's palm oil stocks are expected to be around 1.01 million tonnes at end-September 1997 against 894,000 tonnes at end-September in 1996, the U.S. embassy said on Friday.

"In spite of an expected increase in crude palm oil output, strong overseas demand during the July-September period will move the palm oil stock level close to about the one million level by the end of September," the embassy said in a report.
It did not give an estimate for end-July stocks. Local traders have estimated end-July stocks at 810,000-830,000 tonnes.
The U.S. embassy also said production in the July-September was estimated at 2.38 million tonnes against 2.40 million tonnes in the same period of 1996.
Malaysian private forecaster Ivan Wong on Monday projected output in July at 823,000 tonnes over June's 787,807 tonnes.
